column1: A man who was born on June 14, 1946, in Queens, New York City.
A man who is the 45th and 47th president of the United States.
A man who attended Fordham University before transferring to the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
A man who took over his father Fred Trump's real estate business in 1971.
A man who expanded the family business into Manhattan.
A man who developed properties such as Trump Tower, Trump Plaza, and several casino properties in Atlantic City.
A man who owned the Miss Universe pageant from 1996 to 2015.
A man who hosted and produced the reality television show 'The Apprentice' from 2004 to 2015.
A man who has been married three times, to Ivana Zelníčková, Marla Maples, and Melania Knauss.
A man who has five children: Donald Jr., Ivanka, Eric, Tiffany, and Barron.
A man who announced his candidacy for president in June 2015.
A man who defeated Hillary Clinton in the 2016 presidential election.
A man who took office as president on January 20, 2017.
A man who implemented tax cuts through the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017.
A man who nominated three justices to the Supreme Court: Neil Gorsuch, Brett Kavanaugh, and Amy Coney Barrett.
A man who withdrew the United States from the Paris Climate Agreement.
A man who initiated the creation of Space Force as a branch of the armed forces.
A man who renegotiated NAFTA into the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA).
A man who met with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un in 2018.
A man who moved the U.S. Embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.
A man who was impeached by the House of Representatives on December 18, 2019.
A man who was acquitted by the Senate on February 5, 2020.
A man who faced a global pandemic (COVID-19) during his presidency.
A man who was impeached a second time on January 13, 2021.
A man who was again acquitted by the Senate following his second impeachment.
A man who lost the 2020 presidential election to Joe Biden.
A man who contested the results of the 2020 election, claiming widespread fraud.
A man who addressed supporters on January 6, 2021, before some stormed the U.S. Capitol.
A man who left office on January 20, 2021.
A man who established his post-presidency office in Palm Beach, Florida.
A man who founded Trump Organization, a conglomerate of hundreds of businesses.
A man who authored several books, including 'The Art of the Deal'.
A man who has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
A man who purchased and renovated the Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida.
A man who owned the New Jersey Generals football team in the 1980s.
A man who has appeared in several films and television shows as himself.
A man who created Trump University, which was later subject to multiple lawsuits.
A man who has filed for corporate bankruptcy six times.
A man who launched Trump Steaks, Trump Vodka, and other branded products.
A man who was born to Fred and Mary Anne Trump.
A man who attended New York Military Academy as a teenager.
A man who received multiple draft deferments during the Vietnam War.
A man who has a distinctive hairstyle that has been the subject of much public discussion.
A man who established Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts in 1995.
A man who has appeared on the cover of Time magazine multiple times.
A man who created a controversial travel ban targeting several predominantly Muslim countries.
A man who appointed his daughter and son-in-law as senior White House advisors.
A man who withdrew the U.S. from the Iran nuclear deal.
A man who maintained an active Twitter account until it was suspended in January 2021.
A man who later created his own social media platform called Truth Social.
A man who was the subject of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation.
A man who implemented tariffs on goods from China and other countries.
A man who signed the First Step Act, a criminal justice reform bill.
A man who declared a national emergency to fund a border wall with Mexico.
A man who developed a reputation for firing staff, both on television and in his administration.
A man who founded Trump Entertainment Resorts.
A man who has licensed his name to buildings he doesn't own.
A man who cut regulations across multiple federal agencies.
A man who brought a different communication style to the White House.
A man who received 74 million votes in the 2020 election, the most of any incumbent president.
A man who faced multiple investigations into his business practices.
A man who brokered the Abraham Accords, normalizing relations between Israel and several Arab nations.
A man who announced his 2024 presidential campaign in November 2022.
A man who faced criminal charges in New York, Georgia, Florida, and Washington D.C.
A man who was convicted in a New York criminal case related to business records in 2024.
A man who survived an assassination attempt during a campaign rally in July 2024.
A man who chose J.D. Vance as his running mate for the 2024 election.
A man who defeated Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election.
A man who was inaugurated for his second term on January 20, 2025.
A man who has frequently used the term 'fake news' to criticize media coverage.
A man who attended the Wharton School of Finance.
A man who has branded buildings, hotels, and golf courses around the world.
A man who has owned the Trump National Golf Club Bedminster in New Jersey.
A man who has challenged the scientific consensus on climate change.
A man who appointed more than 200 federal judges during his first term.
A man who announced the killing of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in 2019.
A man who authorized the killing of Iranian general Qasem Soleimani in 2020.
A man who signed an executive order to create the '1776 Commission'.
A man who supported 'Operation Warp Speed' to develop COVID-19 vaccines.
A man who contracted COVID-19 in October 2020.
A man who had a cameo appearance in the film 'Home Alone 2: Lost in New York'.
A man who has frequently called into Fox News programs.
A man who has hosted Saturday Night Live twice.
A man who participated in WWE's WrestleMania and is in the WWE Hall of Fame.
A man who has claimed to be worth over $10 billion.
A man who founded Trump National Doral Miami, a luxury golf resort.
A man who has owned Trump International Hotel Las Vegas.
A man who received the Ellis Island Medal of Honor in 1986.
A man who has been portrayed by numerous comedians and actors.
A man who has a distinctive speaking style often characterized by superlatives.
A man who avoided alcohol and tobacco throughout his life.
A man who has been known to consume fast food regularly.
A man who prefers well-done steak with ketchup.
A man who had a public feud with Rosie O'Donnell.
A man who established Trump Winery in Virginia.
A man who created the Trump Foundation, which was later dissolved.
A man who appointed Mike Pence as his first vice president.
A man who used the campaign slogan 'Make America Great Again.'
A man who changed his political party affiliation multiple times throughout his life.
A man who is the only U.S. president to be impeached twice.
